bibl.title: Historical Contexts for two Aitia from Book III: ""Acontius & Cydippe"" (frr. 67-75 Pf.) and ""Phrygius & Pieria"" (frr. 80-83 Pf.).
bibl.note: 1. Introduction. - 2. Chronological difficulties in the Callimachean corpus. - 3. ""Acontius & Cydippe"": background. - 4. Cameron's dating of ""Acontius & Cydippe"". - 5. ""Acontius & Cydippe"" and the ""Lock"". - 6. The ""Lock"" and Berenice's marriages. - 7. ""Acontius & Cydippe"" and Berenices's marriages. - 8. ""Phrygius & Pieria"": background. - 9. ""Phrygius & Pieria"" and Cyrenean history. - 10. Conclusions.
bibl.seg: Dee L. Clayman, Historical Contexts for two Aitia from Book III: ""Acontius & Cydippe"" (frr. 67-75 Pf.) and ""Phrygius & Pieria"" (frr. 80-83 Pf.).
M.A. Harder, R.F. Regtuit & G.C. Wakker (edd.), Hellenistic Poetry in Context = Hellenistica Groningana. 20 (Leuven, 2014) pp. 85-102.

1. Introduction. - 2. Chronological difficulties in the Callimachean corpus. - 3. ""Acontius & Cydippe"": background. - 4. Cameron's dating of ""Acontius & Cydippe"". - 5. ""Phrygius & Pieria"" and Cyrenean history. - 10. Conclusions.
